title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 December 2012 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <vmassol> good morning  
11:04 <vmassol> ok I'm done with with week-end fun with Mockito and JUnit Rules ;)  
11:05 <vmassol> now to the release  
11:05 <vmassol> so today is release day  
11:05 <vmassol> let's see how our ci fares… it was not responding during the week end :(  
11:07 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <vmassol> restarting jenkins  
11:38 <Slashman> has quit  
11:38 <vmassol> working on fixing commons build  
11:42 <jvelo> has quit  
11:45 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <mrvanes> has quit  
11:57 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <tdelafosse> has quit  
12:10 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <vmassol> sorry about the instability on the build because of my changes over the weekend, it should be back stable in a few minutes (if not already)  
12:18 <vmassol> so today is release so please don't commit except blocking bugs and commits fixing the build  
12:21 <vmassol> hmm that's not good: thomas is on holiday and hasn't fixed the commons build he broke  
12:30 <Inge-> Do you ever slip on release dates?  
12:32 <vmassol> Inge-: never! :)  
12:51 <Inge-> vmassol: well, enjoy your day :P  
12:57 <sburjan> good morning vmassol. Since we won;t have an M2, should we start our tests right after M1 ?  
13:02 <vmassol> sburjan: yes  
13:09 <vmassol> hopefully build should be ok now (at least till the functional tests)  
13:11 <vmassol> hmm I wonder why platform 4.3 isn't being built: http://ci.xwiki.org/  
13:12 <vmassol> (I pushed a commit to it 7 minutes ago: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commits/stable-4.3.x )  
13:15 <vmassol> ok fixing checkstyle bug introduced by thomas on platform  
13:20 <vmassol> hmm it's not only checkstyle  
13:20 <vmassol> thomas's code is just wrong  
13:20 <vmassol> fixing (I hope I understand it....)  
13:21 <vmassol> there's no tests :(  
13:26 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:48 <Denis> mflorea: Hi, I am trying to install Lyrebird skin with EM, and I got "We couldn't find any extension with id 'jvelociter:lyrebird-skin' and version '0.9'. Make sure you have the right extension repositories configured.". Any clue ?  
13:49 <mflorea> @Denis: no, retry, maybe xwiki.org is slow  
13:50 <Denis> I has answered that very fast  
13:50 <mflorea> can you install other extension (just click install to compute the install plan without actually installing)  
13:51 <Denis> second try, different answer !  
13:51 <Denis> Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.extension.handler.ExtensionHandler] hint = [skin]]  
13:51 <mflorea> when do you get this?  
13:51 <mflorea> before clicking on install?  
13:51 <Denis> second try to install, I got this in the progress  
13:52 <mflorea> so after you click install right?  
13:52 <Denis> before clicking anything in progres  
13:52 <mflorea> so the second time the extension was found  
13:52 <Denis> it seems yes  
13:52 <mflorea> so you didn't even try to install and you see that message in the progress log  
13:53 <mflorea> what XE version?  
13:53 <Denis> very latest stable  
13:53 <Denis> without the 3 commits about properties  
13:53 <mflorea> so 4.4 snapshot?  
13:53 <Denis> no, 4.3  
13:54 <mflorea> ok, maybe tmortagne did some changes  
13:54 <vmassol> unfortunately we can't rely on thomas  
13:54 <msmeria> vmassol: should i remove the Troubleshooting section from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationWebSphere ?  
13:54 <vmassol> he's off during this week  
13:55 <Denis> yes, I know, that is why I asked mflorea :)  
13:55 <vmassol> btw I have a generics question (I'm really bad with generic…)  
13:56 <vmassol> I have this method:  
13:56 <vmassol>     public MockitoComponentMockingRule(Class<? extends T> componentImplementationClass,  
13:56 <vmassol>         List<Class<?>> excludedComponentImplementationDependencies)  
13:56 <vmassol> and the compiler fails to find it with this call:  
13:56 <mflorea> @Denis: unfortunately I don't have time right now to investigate, I'll try to take a look later, to see if I can reproduce.  
13:56 <vmassol>     public final MockitoComponentMockingRule<LoggerManager> mocker =  
13:56 <vmassol>         new MockitoComponentMockingRule<LoggerManager>(DefaultLoggerManager.class, Arrays.asList(ObservationManager.class));  
13:56 <vmassol> any idea of what I'll need to change?  
13:57 <vmassol> (I don't want to have to cast the call as in:  
13:57 <vmassol>     public final MockitoComponentMockingRule<LoggerManager> mocker =  
13:57 <vmassol>         new MockitoComponentMockingRule<LoggerManager>(DefaultLoggerManager.class, Arrays.asList((Class<?>)ObservationManager.class));  
13:57 <vmassol> )  
14:02 <Denis> mflorea: I see no skin handler, probably something new  
14:02 <mflorea> ah, but still, EM should install it as a XAR  
14:03 <mflorea> it's a xar right?  
14:03 <Denis> it is not  
14:03 <Denis> I just notice that now  
14:03 <Denis> manually installing  
14:03 <mflorea> ok, in this case it isn't supported  
14:03 <Denis> this is not what the extension page clain  
14:03 <Denis> s/clain/claim  
14:08 <mflorea> does it have the right extension type set? maybe it was set to "xar"  
14:10 <Denis> it is typed skin  
14:10 <Denis> so it works as expected  
14:10 <mflorea> it is skin, so the bug is in the extension repo app, which shouldn't display "Installable with EM" for this type of extensions  
14:10 <mflorea> at least for now  
14:11 <npm> has quit  
14:12 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <Denis> mflorea: the capability is based on the field "validExtension" which is set to yes right now  
14:16 <vmassol> guys, any idea of how to write this line so that it compiles:  
14:16 <vmassol>     public List<Class<?>> excludedComponentClasses = Arrays.asList(ObservationManager.class);  
14:16 <vmassol> ?  
14:17 <vmassol> the problem is that it returns a List<ObservationManager>  
14:17 <Denis> mflorea: doesn't this same field also filter the list proposed by EM ?  
14:19 <mflorea> I don't know for sure, EM just gets the list of extensions from the repo, so the extensions repo decides which extensions are valid. I guess that the extension repo REST resources use this field.  
14:20 <mflorea> vmassol: public List<?> ...  
14:21 <vmassol> but I like a list containing classes  
14:21 <vmassol> \*I'd like  
14:21 <mflorea> I see  
14:22 <vmassol> otherwise I'll need to do a cast of (Class) on the elements of the list afterwards  
14:22 <vmassol> which is not very nice  
14:22 <vmassol> since i know I want a list of Class to be passed  
14:30 <vmassol> Enygma`: fyi codemirror 3.0 is out: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/CodeMirror/Yh6ORoAuZq0  
14:31 <vmassol> mflorea: btw the following doesn't compile for me (strangely IDEA shows it as valid but fails when compiled with the java compiler):  
14:31 <vmassol> public List<Class<?>> excludedComponentClasses = Arrays.asList((Class<?>)ObservationManager.class);  
14:32 <Denis> vmassol: what is wrong with your code except the unchecked assignment ?  
14:32 <vmassol> public List<Class<?>> excludedComponentClasses = Arrays.asList(ObservationManager.class);  
14:32 <vmassol> this one?  
14:32 <vmassol> it doesn't compile  
14:34 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/4065d860-249c-4221-9086-3b1bf4c1bf99/cf2cad93b881979cf2bf46e857ff88a1  
14:34 <Denis> vmassol: should be List<? extends Class<?>>  no ?  
14:35 <vmassol> ah let me try that, hadn't thought of that  
14:36 <vmassol> works, thanks Denis :)  
14:38 <Enygma`> vmassol: cool! I`ll check it out  
14:43 <Denis> mflorea: should I set the field to no than for this extension ?  
14:45 <mflorea> Denis: I think so  
14:49 <Denis> mflorea: very curious, I have edited the objects, set the field to no, and saved, it has produced 2 history, one to no, and one to yes again !  
14:49 <Denis> I deleted the last version, the one that reset to yes  
14:49 <Denis> it produce a new major version with no change  
14:50 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <Denis> mflorea: seems there is some listener that do weird stuff in my back  
14:51 <mflorea> Denis: probably. I don't know the code of the extension repository  
14:51 <mflorea> (it's different from the EM UI)  
14:51 <mflorea> i.e. it  
14:51 <mflorea> it's a separate app  
14:52 <Denis> mflorea: I know, Thomas work I supposed  
14:52 <mflorea> yes  
14:53 <Denis> seems that we rely to much on him for this, we are missing him now  
14:53 <vmassol> agreed and generally true for any piece of code  
14:54 <vmassol> want to become our second man on extension manager? :)  
14:54 <vmassol> at some point one or several of us will need to read that code and understand it...  
14:55 <mflorea> vmassol: it's not EM in this case, but repo app  
14:55 <vmassol> ok  
14:55 <vmassol> btw platform compiles but some tests still fail, I'm on it  
14:56 <vmassol> I can't reproduce locally ATM  
14:56 <vmassol> I'm referring to http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-faq-test-tests/3030/testReport/org.xwiki.faq.test.ui/FAQTest/org\_xwiki\_faq\_test\_ui\_FAQTest/  
14:57 <Denis> vmassol: I have already some knowledge of EM, but for the repo app, I do not have any for now  
14:59 <msmeria> has quit  
15:01 <Denis> vmassol: currently, what afraid me is that we cannot properly stabilize on EM related stuff during the current cycle. We really need far more testing on that, since each time I try to use it for real, I got different kind of unexpected issues, so small, and so really strange  
15:01 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <vmassol> Denis: yes, I've been telling thomas this and everytime he's told me I was wrong and that is was stable and good  
15:01 <vmassol> but we still have 4.4 and 4.5 (well mostly 4.5 now)  
15:02 <vmassol> but people need to raise issues in jira if they find some  
15:02 <vmassol> ATM I do'nt remember any known issue in JIRA  
15:02 <vmassol> do you know of any?  
15:02 <Denis> I am not sure it will be sufficiant  
15:02 <vmassol> that's not a problem Denis  
15:02 <vmassol> we can have as many bugfix releases as we want  
15:02 <vmassol> 4.5.1, 4.5.2, … 4.5.156  
15:03 <Denis> of course  
15:03 <vmassol> what we need  
15:03 <vmassol> is jira issues  
15:03 <Denis> what I means is that we should create trust in EM, and someone who try to use it, do not expect to test it  
15:03 <Denis> testing is also finding good way to reproduce the issue  
15:04 <Denis> I was unable to open some issue, because I cannot reproduce it twice or that I do not know the minimal case to reproduce it, or if I have misused it, and so on...  
15:05 <Denis> and it happen when you are in hurry generaly  
15:05 <Denis> so what I means, is that we need to do some more formal testing of EM if you want it to be really stable  
15:27 <vmassol> disconnecting to try to reproduce the ci issue, bbiab  
15:29 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <vmassol> has quit  
15:30 <vmassol1> no luck  
15:41 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
15:48 <vmassol> this is what is failing:  
15:48 <vmassol> SAXParserFactory factory = SAXParserFactory.newInstance();  
15:48 <vmassol> boolean validating\_dft = factory.getClass().toString().startsWith("org.apache.xerces.");  
15:48 <vmassol> ...  
15:48 <vmassol> \_parser.getXMLReader().setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/nonvalidating/load-external-dtd", validating);  
15:48 <vmassol> so the last line fails  
15:48 <vmassol> with org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException: http://apache.org/xml/features/nonvalidating/load-external-dtd  
15:48 <vmassol> which means the xml parser doesn't support this feature  
15:48 <vmassol> and since we don't set the org.eclipse.jetty.xml.XmlParser.Validating property  
15:49 <vmassol> it means validation is set to true because we use xerces  
15:49 <vmassol> but xerces is supposed to support validation  
15:49 <vmassol> ...  
15:55 <jvelo> has quit  
16:05 <vmassol> guys I'm stuck ATM so if any of you is free to brainstorm with me about the build issue for platofrm let me know...  
16:06 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <cjd> has quit  
16:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:40 <msmeria> has quit

16:45 <vmassol> has quit  
16:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
16:50 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:52 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <vmassol> ok I know why it fails but I don't understand why… it seems the GNU XML parser is used on agent5 instead of xerces  
17:01 <vmassol> so far I cannot find where it's coming from  
17:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:44 <sburjan> has quit  
17:48 <Denis> has quit  
18:03 <evalica> has quit  
18:07 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:34 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:45 <vmassol> ok hopefully the platform build should be fine...  
18:46 <vmassol> I know, I know, I've said that plenty of times today ;)  
18:48 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
18:48 <vmassol> mflorea: do you know if local changes I made in hudson\_root/workspaces will be overwritten newt time the build runs or do I need to cleanup?  
18:49 <vmassol> I'll clean up just in case...  
18:49 <mflorea> I think Jenkins drops any source changes, but I haven't tested. I did clean up after I debugged :)  
18:50 <mflorea> just to be safe  
18:50 <vmassol> yep  
19:09 <Slashman> has quit  
19:17 <tdelafosse> has quit  
19:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:18 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
20:19 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
20:21 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
20:23 <polx> has quit  
20:38 <msmeria> has quit  
20:42 <fmancinelli> has quit  
20:47 <sdumitriu1> vmassol: Any more thoughts on the UTF-8 vote?  
20:48 <sdumitriu1> xwikibot: Indeed, there are no issues with UTF-8 :)  
21:26 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
21:43 <fmancinelli> has quit  
21:44 <Denis> has quit  
21:47 <vmassol> has quit  
21:54 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
21:55 <jvdrean> sdumitriu: sdumitriu1: I replied about XWIKI-6479, do I miss an obvious downside in my comment ?  
21:57 <sdumitriu1> jvdrean: I agree about public websites  
21:57 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
21:57 <sdumitriu1> But I'd rather have a global setting, instead of per-SSX  
21:57 <sdumitriu1> Configuration of the skinx plugin  
21:57 <jvdrean> sure, I wasn't thinking about a per-SSX setting  
21:58 <sdumitriu1> (btw, I'll start working on a skinx reimplementation as components in a few days)  
21:58 <sdumitriu1> As per inlining, I'm in favor of merging into one external resource per type  
21:59 <sdumitriu1> Not sure name concatenation is right, it will limit the number of possible extensions (URL max length limit)  
21:59 <sdumitriu1> We could instead has the concatenation result and use that as the resource name  
22:00 <jvdrean> sdumitriu1: what about using a hash ?  
22:00 <sdumitriu1> See last messag  
22:00 <sdumitriu1> e  
22:00 <sdumitriu1> WDYT?  
22:01 <jvdrean> I think we're saying the exact same thing :)  
22:01 <jvdrean> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6479?focusedCommentId=73059&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-73059  
22:01 <sdumitriu1> Ah, right  
22:01 <jvdrean> (edited for readability)  
22:01 <mrvanes> has quit  
22:01 <sdumitriu1> Didn't read through the end  
22:02 <jvdrean> :)  
22:04 <jvdrean> sdumitriu1: have you looked at the current implementation of the wiki components module ? any thoughts about using those to refactor ssx/jsx ?  
22:05 <sdumitriu1> I think it would make sense to have a global switch: wiki deployment status: development|production  
22:05 <sdumitriu1> Hm, interesting idea  
22:05 <sdumitriu1> I'll have to think about it  
22:05 <sdumitriu1> Do you have anything specific in mind?  
22:06 <jvdrean> nothing special but they are good candidates, wikicomponents remove some of the hassle about binding a document to a component  
22:07 <jvdrean> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WikiComponent+Module#HBindcomponentimplementationstodocuments  
22:08 <jvdrean> also the scope (global / current wiki / current user) is handled by them through the different component managers  
22:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
